text: hi everyone today I will share with you
my secret recipes for making Vietnamese
pickles I will be making five different
kinds of Vietnamese because with the
same recipe and let's see how they
turned out
let's begin step 1 choose and prepare
the ingredients for pickled mustard
greens choose the one with thicker stems
remove the bad parts and then sundry for
about 2 to 3 hours if it's not sunny
where you live you can leave it on the
counter to dry for about half a day cut
the mustard greens into about 2 inch
length rings well a few time and grain
typical mix vegetables you can use
cauliflower carrot kohlrabi cucumber
ginger chiles and shallots separate the
cauliflower and cut into small florets
cut the kohlrabi into stick using a wavy
knife remove the seeds of the cucumber
and cut into about half an inch thick
slices for shallot just peel and cut in
half step 2 sterilizing the jars and the
utensils to make sure the pecos don't go
bad make sure the pickling jars are
perfectly clean it's best to use glass
jar all the utensil you use in the
pickling process have to be clean and
free of oil otherwise it will not get
fermented properly and it's easy to go
back the next step is to prepare the
brine this is a very crucial step
because if we decide the taste of the
pecos later and use the purified water
from my pure water filter at home to
make sure that the water is perfectly
clean and no contamination in the water
that will interfere the fermentation
process with one and a half liter of
water add 2 tbsp of salt a tablespoon of
sugar and half a cup of rice rings in
water that's the water that we use to
wash the rice
use the rice water after the third wash
to make sure that is really clean stir
well until the sugar and salt is fully
dissolved next other tips for prickling
different kinds of vegetables for
mustard greens in order to get the
really nice yellow color and crunchy
pickers you bring a large saucepan of
water to a full boil and then turn off
the heat then add the mustard greens and
place a plate on top push it out to make
sure the buttercream is fully submerged
in the water leave overnight the mustard
greens will turn pale yellow and the
myrrh stock taste is less spicy putting
a jar
together with some chopped green onions
and chilies pour the pickling brine to
fill the jar for the mixed vegetables
toss with some salt and leave for about
half an hour to remove the water content
in the vegetables some dry for about
half a day to make sure that this will
be crunchy place them in a jar adjusting
the beautiful flowers against the wall
so they will all look pretty push it
down to make sure is fully submerged for
the baby eggplants you remove the stem
do not cut into it so that the Pickers
won't turn soft after pickling soak them
in salted water for about 15 minutes and
insert in a jar together with something
less lights galangal and chilies for
pickling sprouts I mix bean sprouts with
shredded carrots some garlic chives and
julienne ginger you pour the brine over
and soak for about 1 hour so it will be
wilted and it's easier to insert into a
jar that way for pickled cabbage I mixed
cabbage with Vietnamese mint some
shredded carrot and same thing putting
the job or the bright and close
you just leave them in one place
undisturbed for about two to three days
and they will be nicely pickled and
becomes really crunchy and delicious
they will become faster under the Sun
when you take the pickles out the char
make sure that you use the clean
utensils and use them from the top to
the bottom
gradually one is nily sour you can put
into the fridge to slow down the
fermentation it's really great to serve
with meat dishes and grilled food you
can use them to cook sweet and sour soup
or embrace dishes and this pretty jars
could be great decor for your little
kitchen corner right I hope you like
today video and don't forget to thumbs
up and subscribe I will see you back
next time bye
